All Classes

Class Description
ActionType
Different types of piece movements.
AI
This class determines moves for the AI and also sends the move in the form of coordinates to the GameEngine to execute the move
AICreator
This class initializes the AI
BackEndExternalAPI
Classes that implement this interface are meant to be passed around the front end in order to call the appropriate methods on the back end
BadDataTest
Methods to test the engine and it's interactions with the viewController
BasicEngineTest
Methods to test the engine and it's interactions with the viewController
BasicPieceTest
Testing class for piece creation, reflection for various piece components, and basic testing of getAllPossibleMoves
BasicPlaceGameTest  
Board
The board used to house all of the GamePieces
Board
Purpose: a visual representation of the board.
BoardController
This is a concrete implementation of what is passed around in the back end to make method calls to the front end.
BoardCreator
This class creates the gameboard object that holds all of the game pieces
BoardScene
This scene holds the view representation of the main game board.
BoardTest  
Check
Checks if the user will be in check after the move in question is made
CheckerPromotion
Converts the checker to a king when it makes it to the last row
CheckersTurnCondition
This class is used to determine if the turn is over for a specific game type, and is defined in the games .xml file This class is dependant on the TurnConditionResult enum.
ClassLoaderException
Used to make exceptions relating to reflection and class loading This class assumes that the user provides a String error message or an Error upon declaration Code Example:
ClickExecutor
Meant to process clicks from the front end and execute the proper actions on the board
ClickExecutorInitializer
This class gets the proper ClickExecutor for a specific game This class assumes that within the game_rules .xml file there is a <gameType>Move</gameType> or <gameType>Place</gameType> parameter.
CompletedAction
Meant to be used to record a completed action on the board.
Condition
Meant to be used as a component of a piece movement object.
ConditionClassLoader
Used for making win conditions
ConstantTurnCondition
This class is used to determine if the turn is over for a specific game type, and is defined in the games .xml file This class is dependant on the TurnConditionResult enum.
Coordinate
Used to represent coordinate values.
Creator
Meant to be extended by creators to make different components of the game.
Display Deprecated.
DukeApplicationTest
This class acts as an intermediary between an OpenJFX application and TestFX.
DummyViewController  
EndGameConditioin
This interface can be extended to be used for many different types of win conditions
Engine
Implemented by any type of game engine that is designed to run a specific type of program.
EngineInitializer
These methods are designed to initialize parts of the game that the engine needs to run.
EnPassant
The en passant movement in chess.
FileSaverTest  
FiniteJump
This movement class represents a piece that can travel over other pieces, but only for a specified number of spaces This class should be used via reflection, and should be defined in the GamePiece's .xml file in the nested parameters:
FiniteSlide
This movement class represents a move that can travel an finite number of spaces in a certain direction.
FirstMove
This restriction is used to make sure a move is only valid if it is a piece's first move
FloatingWindow  
FloatingWindow
A window that floats above a parent window.
ForceTurnCondition
This class is used to determine if the turn is over for a specific game type, and is defined in the games .xml file This class is dependant on the TurnConditionResult enum.
FourInARow
This class is used to determine if someone has won the current game, by checking if the opponent team ahs any possible moves This class assumes a defined FrontEndExternalAPI is passed in, as well as the current GameBoard This class depends upon FrontEndExternalAPI.java and GameBoard.java Code Example: //assumes GameBoard gameBoard and FrontEndExternalAPI frontEndExternalAPI have been previously defined EndGameCondition endGameCondition = new FourInARow(frontEndExternalAPI, gameBoard); gameBoard.movePiece(0,0); if(endGameCondition.checkForWin){ exit(0); } //continue the game
FrontEndExternalAPI
Classes that implement this interface are meant to be passed around the back end in order to call the appropriate methods on the front end
FrontEndInternalAPI Deprecated.
GameAlert
A custom alert window class that displays an alert with the desired message.
GameBoard
This is the representation of the board.
GameBoardTest  
GameBoardViewController Deprecated.
GameConfigScene
This scene holds configuration settings and controls for a new game.
GameDisplay Deprecated.
GameEngine
This is the engine used for running a game.
GameMenuBar
Populates the system default menu bar on MacOS devices.
GamePiece
Represents a generic game piece.
GameRules
This class defines the set of rules to be followed by a game, such as the win conditions and the turn conditions Example Code: GameBoard board = new GameBoard(8, 8); DummyViewController viewController = new DummyViewController(); GameRules gameRules = new GameRules("testConstant", viewController, board); assertFalse(gameRules.checkForNextTurn(board, basicTestPiece)); //this test should always return False, for if you check the testConstant.txt file you will see that the TurnCondition is set to Constant
GameRulesTest  
GameRunningException
Used to throw exceptions related to the game board
GameScene
A GameScene object extends Scene and is given to a GameWindow to show.
GameSceneFactory
Creates GameScene subclasses, however returns the general GameScene object rather than the concrete subclass.
GameWindow
The top level UI element of a view.
GameWindowFactory
This class creates objects that extend GameWindow.
Gravity
This class represents a piece that falls to the lowest possible y-coordinate vacant on the GameBoard, while maintaining its x-coordinate.
InfiniteSlide
This movement class represents a move that can travel an infinite number of spaces in a certain direction.
Initializer
This interface will be used to initialize all types of games.
KingSideCastle
The piece movement that corresponds to the king side castle.
Main
This is the class that is run to instantiate the front and back end, and link them together
MainTest
Feel free to completely change this code or delete it entirely.
ModelController
This class is used to interact with the modules in the backend.
MoveClickExecutor
Meant to process clicks from the front end and execute the proper actions on the board
NoHeldPieceTurnCondition
This class is used to determine if the turn is over for a specific game type, and is defined in the games .xml file This class is dependant on the TurnConditionResult enum.
NoMoves
This class is used to determine if someone has won the current game, by checking if the opponent team ahs any possible moves This class assumes a defined FrontEndExternalAPI is passed in, as well as the current GameBoard This class depends upon FrontEndExternalAPI.java and GameBoard.java Code Example: //assumes GameBoard gameBoard and FrontEndExternalAPI frontEndExternalAPI have been previously defined EndGameCondition endGameCondition = new NoMoves(frontEndExternalAPI, gameBoard); gameBoard.movePiece(0,0); if(endGameCondition.checkForWin){ exit(0); } //continue the game
PawnPromotion
Sends a list of possible pieces to the front end when the pawn reaches the last rank.
PieceComponentClassLoader
Used to load the different components that compose a piece
PieceCreator
This class is used to coordinate the creation of pieces, starting from parsing through the XML file and then going on to use reflection to compose the pieces
PieceMovement
This class is used to represent a singular move that a piece can do.
PlaceClickExecutor
Meant to process clicks from the front end and execute the proper actions on the board
Player
Loaded in from an XML file by the PlayerFileSaver.
PlayerCreator  
PlayerFileException
Used to make exceptions relating to loading in the player files
PlayerFileSaver
Used to read in and save player files
PromptTurnCondition
This class is used to determine if the turn is over for a specific game type, and is defined in the games .xml file This class is dependant on the TurnConditionResult enum.
QueenSideCastle
The piece movement that corresponds to the queen side castle.
Record
A record corresponding to a certain game
Restriction
Meant to be used as a component of a piece movement object, gives the movement some type of restriction that alters how it is able to move
RestrictionAndConditionTest
Methods to test the engine and it's interactions with the viewController
RunningCheckerTest  
RunningChessTest  
StageWindow
A subclass of GameWindow that extends Stage.
Tile
purpose: it is part of a board, can have a piece and change colors.
TurnCondition
This class is used to determine if the turn is over for a specific game type, and is defined in the games .xml file This class is dependant on the TurnConditionResult enum.
TurnConditionResult
This enum defines the possible outcomes for TurnCondition.java
TurnManager
Designed to manage the changing of turns in a game.
ViewManager
Instantiates and manages all views for a single game instance.
ViewTest
JavaFX tests for the game.
WelcomeScene
A subclass of GameScene, this scene is the first one viewers see when starting the game.
XMLNestParsingTest  
XMLParseException
Make exceptions related to XML parsing
XMLParser
This class handles parsing XML files.
